text: Hey galapagos team, that 3d printer blog post I put up this morning  â€” there's something funny happening with the first photo after the writing segment. It' supposed to be the same dimensions as the photo below it, but it's blown up and in square format. Do any of you know what caused this? Should I re-upload it?
trent are those two photos the exact same size?
it looks like it's trying to stretch it to fill the width
<@U026E0ZNR> It's b/c their aspect ratios are different.
I'm fairly certain the photos I uploaded were the exact same size. In galapagos the are both landscape orientation.
(the thumbnails, that is)

This is what it looks like in galapagos.
The images are the exact same size on my computer.... the same ones I uploaded
i think it's worth reuplolading the top image and seeing if that fixes it
when i open your post on the admin it looks stretched
so something funky is goin on
Don't trust the galapagos preview. It will crop the images to a specific W/H
the cms side isn't representational
gotcha
Ok, I can re-upload it. Just confused why it distorted the first and not the second one.
i'm confused too
i'm also confused. seems like it's working how it is supposed to work
Because the aspect ratio of the first image is similar to the image you uploaded
Gaston's Tusk post is a great example of how images work
ugh, didn't change anything. They are the exact dimessions that the upload dialogue suggests (1920 x 1280)
it's cropping the photo to a square. does it normally crop images? It's not being stretched.
That's odd. I would say try re-uploding the thing and if we're still having issues let's look at the CMS.
I just tried re-uploading the same (correct) image and it didn't change anything.
how did we fix it? looks good now
I saved a new photo with a different file name and that took care of it.
weird
